hive.state.simulation_state module¶

class hive.state.simulation_state.SimulationState[source]¶

Bases: tuple

resolution of ‘11’ is within 25 meters/82 feet. this decides how granular the simulation will operate for internal operations. the user can still specify their own level of granularity for https://uber.github.io/h3/#/documentation/core-library/resolution-table

current_time_seconds()[source]¶

computes the current time in seconds :rtype: Unit :return: the current time in seconds

add_request(request)[source]¶

adds a request to the SimulationState :type request: Request :param request: the request to add :rtype: Union[Exception, SimulationState] :return: the updated simulation state, or an error

remove_request(request_id)[source]¶

removes a request from this simulation. called once a Request has been fully serviced and is no longer alive in the simulation. :type request_id: str :param request_id: id of the request to delete :rtype: Union[Exception, SimulationState] :return: the updated simulation state (does not report failure)

modify_request(updated_request)[source]¶

given an updated request, update the SimulationState with that request :type updated_request: Request :param updated_request: :rtype: Union[Exception, SimulationState] :return: the updated simulation, or an error

add_vehicle(vehicle)[source]¶

adds a vehicle into the region supported by the RoadNetwork in this SimulationState :type vehicle: Vehicle :param vehicle: a vehicle :rtype: Union[Exception, SimulationState] :return: updated SimulationState, or SimulationStateError

modify_vehicle(updated_vehicle)[source]¶

given an updated vehicle, update the SimulationState with that vehicle :type updated_vehicle: Vehicle :param updated_vehicle: the vehicle after calling a transition function and .step() :rtype: Union[Exception, SimulationState] :return: the updated simulation, or an error

apply_instruction(i)[source]¶

test if vehicle transition is valid, and if so, apply it, resolving any externalities in the process :type i: Instruction :param i: the instruction to apply :rtype: Optional[SimulationState] :return: the updated simulation state or an exception on failure

step_vehicle(vehicle_id)[source]¶
Return type

SimulationState

step_simulation()[source]¶

advances this simulation :rtype: SimulationState :return: the simulation after calling step() on all vehicles

remove_vehicle(vehicle_id)[source]¶

removes the vehicle from play (perhaps to simulate a broken vehicle or end of a shift) :type vehicle_id: str :param vehicle_id: the id of the vehicle :rtype: Union[Exception, SimulationState] :return: the updated simulation state

pop_vehicle(vehicle_id)[source]¶

removes a vehicle from this SimulationState, which updates the state and also returns the vehicle. supports shipping this vehicle to another cluster node. :type vehicle_id: str :param vehicle_id: the id of the vehicle to pop :rtype: Union[Exception, Tuple[SimulationState, Vehicle]] :return: either a Tuple containing the updated state and the vehicle, or, an error

add_station(station)[source]¶

adds a station to the simulation :type station: Station :param station: the station to add :rtype: Union[Exception, SimulationState] :return: the updated SimulationState, or a SimulationStateError

remove_station(station_id)[source]¶

remove a station from the simulation. maybe they closed due to inclement weather. :type station_id: str :param station_id: the id of the station to remove :rtype: Union[Exception, SimulationState] :return: the updated simulation state, or an exception

modify_station(updated_station)[source]¶

given an updated station, update the SimulationState with that station :type updated_station: Station :param updated_station: :rtype: Union[Exception, SimulationState] :return: the updated simulation, or an error

add_base(base)[source]¶

adds a base to the simulation :type base: Base :param base: the base to add :rtype: Union[Exception, SimulationState] :return: the updated SimulationState, or a SimulationStateError

remove_base(base_id)[source]¶

remove a base from the simulation. all your base belong to us. :type base_id: str :param base_id: the id of the base to remove :rtype: Union[Exception, SimulationState] :return: the updated simulation state, or an exception

modify_base(updated_base)[source]¶

given an updated base, update the SimulationState with that base :type updated_base: Base :param updated_base: :rtype: Union[Exception, SimulationState] :return: the updated simulation, or an error

add_powertrain(powertrain)[source]¶

Adds a powertrain to the simulation :type powertrain: Powertrain :param powertrain: :rtype: Union[Exception, SimulationState] :return:

add_powercurve(powercurve)[source]¶

Adds a powercurve to the simulation :type powercurve: Powercurve :param powercurve: :rtype: Union[Exception, SimulationState] :return:

update_road_network(sim_time)[source]¶

trigger the update of the road network model based on the current sim time :type sim_time: int :param sim_time: the current sim time :rtype: SimulationState :return: updated simulation state (and road network)

at_geoid(geoid)[source]¶

returns a dictionary with the list of ids found at this location for all entities :type geoid: str :param geoid: geoid to look up :rtype: Union[Exception, AtLocationResponse] :return: an Optional AtLocationResponse

vehicle_at_request(vehicle_id, request_id, override_resolution=None)[source]¶

tests whether vehicle is at the request within the scope of the given geoid resolution :type vehicle_id: str :param vehicle_id: the vehicle we are testing for proximity to a request :type request_id: str :param request_id: the request we are testing for proximity to a vehicle :type override_resolution: Optional[int] :param override_resolution: a resolution to use for geo intersection test; if None, use self.sim_h3_resolution :rtype: Union[SimulationStateError, bool] :return: bool

vehicle_at_station(vehicle_id, station_id, override_resolution=None)[source]¶

tests whether vehicle is at the station within the scope of the given geoid resolution :type vehicle_id: str :param vehicle_id: the vehicle we are testing for proximity to a request :type station_id: str :param station_id: the station we are testing for proximity to a vehicle :type override_resolution: Optional[int] :param override_resolution: a resolution to use for geo intersection test; if None, use self.sim_h3_resolution :rtype: Union[SimulationStateError, bool] :return: bool

vehicle_at_base(vehicle_id, base_id, override_resolution=None)[source]¶

tests whether vehicle is at the request within the scope of the given geoid resolution :type vehicle_id: str :param vehicle_id: the vehicle we are testing for proximity to a request :type base_id: str :param base_id: the base we are testing for proximity to a vehicle :type override_resolution: Optional[int] :param override_resolution: a resolution to use for geo intersection test; if None, use self.sim_h3_resolution :rtype: Union[SimulationStateError, bool] :return: bool

board_vehicle(request_id, vehicle_id)[source]¶

places passengers from a request into a Vehicle :type request_id: str :param request_id: the request that will board the vehicle; removes the request from the simulation :type vehicle_id: str :param vehicle_id: :rtype: Union[SimulationStateError, SimulationState] :return: updated simulation state, or an error. vehicle position is idempotent.

hive.state.simulation_state_ops module¶

hive.state.simulation_state_ops.apply_instructions(simulation_state, instructions)[source]¶

applies all the instructions to the simulation state, ignoring the ones that fail :type simulation_state: SimulationState :param simulation_state: the sim state :type instructions: Tuple[Instruction, …] :param instructions: dispatcher instructions :rtype: SimulationState :return: the sim state with vehicle intentions updated

hive.state.simulation_state_ops.initial_simulation_state(road_network, vehicles=(), stations=(), bases=(), powertrains=(), powercurves=(), start_time=0, sim_timestep_duration_seconds=<Quantity(1, 'second')>, sim_h3_resolution=15)[source]¶

constructs a SimulationState from sets of vehicles, stations, and bases, along with a road network :type powercurves: Tuple[Type[Powercurve], …] :param powercurves: :type powertrains: Tuple[Type[Powertrain], …] :param powertrains: :type road_network: RoadNetwork :param road_network: the (initial) road network :type vehicles: Tuple[Vehicle, …] :param vehicles: the vehicles available in this simulation :type stations: Tuple[Station, …] :param stations: the stations available in this simulation :type bases: Tuple[Base, …] :param bases: the bases available in this simulation :type start_time: int :param start_time: the start time for this simulation (by default, time step 0) :type sim_timestep_duration_seconds: Unit :param sim_timestep_duration_seconds: the size of a time step in seconds :type sim_h3_resolution: int :param sim_h3_resolution: the h3 resolution for internal positioning (comparison ops can override) :rtype: Tuple[SimulationState, Tuple[SimulationStateError, …]] :return: a SimulationState, or a SimulationStateError
